content:
• Tuesday, July 19, 2011
  • AAPL

    Additional details from Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) FQ3 CC: iTunes revs. up 36% Y/Y; 86% of Fortune...

    Additional details from Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) FQ3 CC: iTunes revs. up 36% Y/Y; 86% of Fortune 500 companies testing/using iPad; China revs. up over 6x to $3.8B; iPad outsells Macs in K-12 market; company says "future product transition" (likely new iPhone) could affect FQ4 sales; says it has "more to learn" about playing in prepaid phone market (cheaper iPhone?). Shares +5.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:27 PM | 4 Comments
  • INFN

    Infinera (NASDAQ:INFN) reports Q2 non-GAAP EPS of ($0.11), in-line with consensus. Revenue of...

    Infinera (NASDAQ:INFN) reports Q2 non-GAAP EPS of ($0.11), in-line with consensus. Revenue of $96M (-14% Y/Y) beats by $1.5M. Non-GAAP gross margin of 41%, down from 48% in Q1 and 44% in Q2 2010. Shares +5% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:56 PM
  • ISRG

    Intuitive Surgical (NASDAQ:ISRG): Q2 EPS of $2.91 beats by $0.20. Revenue of $425.7M (+21% Y/Y)....

    Intuitive Surgical (NASDAQ:ISRG): Q2 EPS of $2.91 beats by $0.20. Revenue of $425.7M (+21% Y/Y). Shares +5.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM
  • AAPL

    Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) shares resume trading after another blowout beat, +6% AH. (More: I, II)

    Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) shares resume trading after another blowout beat, +6% AH. (More: I, II)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM | 2 Comments
  • VMW

    More on VMWare (NYSE:VMW): easily tops Q2 estimates, with profits tripling on a surge in...

    More on VMWare (NYSE:VMW): easily tops Q2 estimates, with profits tripling on a surge in licensing revenue and margins benefiting from a 114% increase in operating cash flow. Shares +6.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM
  • VMW

    VMware (NYSE:VMW): Q2 EPS $0.51 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $921.2M (+36% Y/Y). Shares +6.6% AH. (PR)

    VMware (NYSE:VMW): Q2 EPS $0.51 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $921.2M (+36% Y/Y). Shares +6.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM
  • INTC

    Altera (NASDAQ:ALTR): Q2 EPS of $0.65 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $548M (+17% Y/Y). Shares +1.6%...

    Altera (NASDAQ:ALTR): Q2 EPS of $0.65 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $548M (+17% Y/Y). Shares +1.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • AABA

    More on Yahoo's (YHOO) Q2 results: The company reports Q2 search revenues excluding traffic...

    More on Yahoo's (YHOO) Q2 results: The company reports Q2 search revenues excluding traffic acquisition costs (TAC) fell 15% Y/Y; display revenues ex-TAC were up 5% Y/Y. Q2 free cash flow was $92M, down 25% Y/Y. Yahoo sees Q3 revenues ex-TAC of $1.05B-$1.1B, below the $1.12B consensus. Shares -2.4% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • NEWN

    Lithium battery maker New Energy Systems (OTC:NEWN) finished the day up a stunning +66% after...

    Lithium battery maker New Energy Systems (OTC:NEWN) finished the day up a stunning +66% after introducing three new remote power Anytone models for tablets and mobile devices. It begins shipping to its distributors in August, and will formally launch in September.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • RVBD

    Riverbed (NASDAQ:RVBD) reports FQ2 EPS of $0.21, in-line with consensus. Revenues of $170.3M...

    Riverbed (NASDAQ:RVBD) reports FQ2 EPS of $0.21, in-line with consensus. Revenues of $170.3M (+35% Y/Y) fall short of the $172.9M consensus. The company attributes the shortfall to "softness in the EMEA region." Shares -22.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 2 Comments
  • CMG

    Chipotle (NYSE:CMG) -4.6% AH after coming up $0.09 light on its Q2 EPS estimate of $1.59. Higher...

    Chipotle (NYSE:CMG) -4.6% AH after coming up $0.09 light on its Q2 EPS estimate of $1.59. Higher costs look to be the culprit as operating margins drop to 25.8% from 26.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO): Q2 EPS of $0.19 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $1.12B (-5% Y/Y). Shares -2.5% AH. (PR)

    Yahoo (YHOO): Q2 EPS of $0.19 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $1.12B (-5% Y/Y). Shares -2.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • GOOG

    Several analysts are out with bullish notes on Motorola Mobility (MMI +4.9%), which is down...

    Several analysts are out with bullish notes on Motorola Mobility (MMI +4.9%), which is down nearly 22% YTD on concerns over Android share losses. Susquehanna is positive on Motorola's Chinese growth; UBS believes its patent portfolio is underappreciated; and ThinkEquity sees the handset business returning to profitability in Q3.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM
  • BRO

    Brown & Brown (BRO -7.5%) takes a hit after reporting a Q2 earnings miss late yesterday. The...

    Brown & Brown (BRO -7.5%) takes a hit after reporting a Q2 earnings miss late yesterday. The company beat on top-line revenues, but brokerage cost increases and higher loss ratios from its insurance carriers outpaced improvement in commissions and fees.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM
  • RTEC

    Test equipment provider Rudolph Technologies (RTEC -9%) trades lower after saying earlier its Q2...

    Test equipment provider Rudolph Technologies (RTEC -9%) trades lower after saying earlier its Q2 will miss estimates. Revenue will now fall to $50-$52M - the low end of previous guidance. The company also plans to offer $50M in convertible senior notes, which will have a dilutive effect on earnings for Q3.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:05 PM

  • Precious metals dive in wake of optimism over a possible debt deal, silver falling more than...

    Precious metals dive in wake of optimism over a possible debt deal, silver falling more than 2.5% in the minutes following President Obama's comments. It makes Cullen Roche want to bang his head against a wall. "Did people really buy silver thinking that the U.S. would go bankrupt?" SLV -2.9%, GLD -1.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:05 PM | 30 Comments
  • IBM

    Following IBM's Q2 results, Collins Stewart touts the company's booming mainframe business, and...

    Following IBM's Q2 results, Collins Stewart touts the company's booming mainframe business, and expects software sales to remain strong; and Citi notes how growth is strong in both North America and emerging markets. However, Gleacher & Co. questions "how much operating leverage remains in the company's financial model." Shares +5.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM
  • KND

    Jefferies downgrades Kindred Healthcare (KND -0.4%), Skilled Healthcare (SKH -0.3%) and Sun...

    Jefferies downgrades Kindred Healthcare (KND -0.4%), Skilled Healthcare (SKH -0.3%) and Sun Healthcare (SUNH -1.8%) to Hold from Buy based on an increasing likelihood that skilled nursing facilities and long-term care hospitals will face multiple years of Medicare pricing pressure, with the overhang keeping shares rangebound for the foreseeable future.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • ST

    Shares of Sensata Technologies (ST +1.9%) spike higher after the firm is initiated at Pacific...

    Shares of Sensata Technologies (ST +1.9%) spike higher after the firm is initiated at Pacific Crest with an Outperform rating.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • LEDS

    SemiLEDs (NASDAQ:LEDS) leaps +12% on speculation General Electric (GE +1.2%) has taken a stake.

    SemiLEDs (NASDAQ:LEDS) leaps +12% on speculation General Electric (GE +1.2%) has taken a stake.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM
  • HOLX

    Gen-Probe (NASDAQ:GPRO) -3% on reports that Novartis is no longer pursuing an acquisition.

    Gen-Probe (NASDAQ:GPRO) -3% on reports that Novartis is no longer pursuing an acquisition.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:29 PM
  • FSLR

    European firm REC writes off $1.2B as competition from Chinese companies and falling prices on...

    European firm REC writes off $1.2B as competition from Chinese companies and falling prices on wafers increasingly threatens the solar industry. Analysts see a shakeout beginning, with possible consolidation down the road. Unperturbed solar gainers: FSLR +1.4%, YGE +3.7%, LDK +2.3%, TSL +3.1%, JASO +2.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM
  • JNJ

    Despite a solid earnings beat, Johnson & Johnson (JNJ -1.1%) drifts lower after...

    Despite a solid earnings beat, Johnson & Johnson (JNJ -1.1%) drifts lower after offering cautious guidance and leaving its full-year profit view unchanged. But Leerink Swann thinks "with now two consecutive ahead-of-consensus quarters to start the year, investors will view the reiterated EPS guidance as conservative, leaving room for upside through 2H11."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • DDD

    3D Systems (DDD +6.6%) trades higher today after buying Alibre, a mid-market provider of 3D...

    3D Systems (DDD +6.6%) trades higher today after buying Alibre, a mid-market provider of 3D design productivity solutions. Financial terms weren't disclosed, but the company expects the acquisition to be immediately accretive to net income.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • NUVA

    NuVasive (NUVA +4.5%) pops on a Baird upgrade to outperfrom. Baird cites its proprietary survey...

    NuVasive (NUVA +4.5%) pops on a Baird upgrade to outperfrom. Baird cites its proprietary survey of spine/neurosurgeons suggesting spine market dynamics are somewhat flat, but the industry's conversion to lateral lumbar fusion creates an opportunity for NuVasive to gain market share.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM
  • NWS

    The Murdochs' strategy of having James bore the MPs panel into a slumber has worked and their...

    The Murdochs' strategy of having James bore the MPs panel into a slumber has worked and their testimony ends without major revelations. Despite Rupert coming across as an "old dodderer," News Corp.'s (NASDAQ:NWS) shares are +4.4%. Rebekah Brooks is now on. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM | 4 Comments
  • MMR

    McMoRan Exploration (MMR -4.6%) takes a hit after reporting Q2 net losses were greater than...

    McMoRan Exploration (MMR -4.6%) takes a hit after reporting Q2 net losses were greater than expected. Despite beating on the top-line sales number, the bottom-line suffered on higher-than-expected impairment and exploration charges.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM
  • IBM

    During its FQ2 earnings call, IBM reported making 250 "competitive displacements" of rival...

    During its FQ2 earnings call, IBM reported making 250 "competitive displacements" of rival server gear, with about 60% of those displacements involving Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) hardware. Weak hardware sales were a major reason for Oracle's uninspiring FQ4 results.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM
  • NWS

    The Murdoch (NWS +5.7%) phone-scandal hearing has resumed after an interruption caused by a...

    The Murdoch (NWS +5.7%) phone-scandal hearing has resumed after an interruption caused by a physical scuffle as a young man appeared to try to shove a shaving-cream pie into Rupert Murdoch's face. (earlier: succession questions)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM
  • KNDI

    China's leading off-road and electric vehicle maker Kandi Technolgies (KNDI +28%) leaps after...

    China's leading off-road and electric vehicle maker Kandi Technolgies (KNDI +28%) leaps after its board of directors authorizes a $5M stock repurchase program. The company plans to fund the repurchases from its available cash balance.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM
  • GMCR

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR +4.5%) soar, tracking close to 52-week highs. John Markman...

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR +4.5%) soar, tracking close to 52-week highs. John Markman of Markman Capital Insight Research likes the stock for technical reasons, viewing the iShares S&P MidCap 400 ETF (IJH +1.3%) (with component GMCR) as set for an upside breakout.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM | 1 Comment
  • ETFC

    Shares of ETrade Financial (ETFC +3.1%) pop on rumors of an investment by Carl Icahn.

    Shares of ETrade Financial (ETFC +3.1%) pop on rumors of an investment by Carl Icahn.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • NFLX

    Oppenheimer boosts its price target for Netflix (NFLX +3.5%) to $360 from $280, citing expansion...

    Oppenheimer boosts its price target for Netflix (NFLX +3.5%) to $360 from $280, citing expansion that is transforming its model for global content distribution. Netflix has reached an “inflection point in its higher margin online streaming subscription business,” as strong subscriber growth is coupled with falling subscriber acquisition costs and churn rates.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM | 5 Comments
  • BAC

    A bounce at the open doesn't help as Bank of America (BAC -2.5%) turns tail to hit another...

    A bounce at the open doesn't help as Bank of America (BAC -2.5%) turns tail to hit another multi-year low following earnings. "We've gone full circle here," says analyst Mike Mayo on the conference call, noting talk of a dividend increase has been replaced by chatter about a capital raise.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM | 1 Comment
  • GS

    "I don't want to sugarcoat things, we underperformed during the quarter," says Goldman (GS...

    "I don't want to sugarcoat things, we underperformed during the quarter," says Goldman (GS -1.2%) CFO Viniar on the earnings conference call. "Maybe we made a bad decision in taking too little risk in Q1." He expects headcount cuts of around 1K globally. Shares are well off their lows of the session.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM | 1 Comment
  • FIO

    Fusion-IO (FIO -4.1%) is getting a fairly cool reception from the analysts associated with its...

    Fusion-IO (FIO -4.1%) is getting a fairly cool reception from the analysts associated with its underwriters. While Credit Suisse is bullish due to positive data center trends driving demand for Fusion-IO's high-speed memory modules, Goldman, Morgan Stanley, and JPMorgan are all neutral, primarily due to the company's valuation.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM
  • IBM

    IBM's (IBM +3.9%) strong results helps lift the Philadelphia Semiconductor Index (SOXX +3.1%) on...

    IBM's (IBM +3.9%) strong results helps lift the Philadelphia Semiconductor Index (SOXX +3.1%) on an outlook for increasing IT spending. Select semiconductor stocks receive an additional boost with Buy ratings from Jefferies: Broadcom (BRCM +4.8%), Marvell (MRVL +2.9%), Texas Instruments (TXN +2.1%).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM
  • GS

    By far the largest culprit behind Goldman's (GS -0.5%) lackluster Q2 results is the decline in...

    By far the largest culprit behind Goldman's (GS -0.5%) lackluster Q2 results is the decline in the company's trading operations, with its revenues plunging 47% from Q1. Accompanying this decline is a diminished risk appetite, with the firm's "value at risk" on a given day falling to $101M, its lowest level since Q3 2006.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM | 2 Comments
  • SBLK

    Star Bulk Carriers (SBLK -16.4%) sinks after the Greek shipper prices its 16.7M share secondary...

    Star Bulk Carriers (SBLK -16.4%) sinks after the Greek shipper prices its 16.7M share secondary offering at $1.80 per share. The Company plans to use the proceeds to purchase two second-hand drybulk carriers.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • CDTI

    Clean Diesel Technologies (OTC:CDTI +18.8%) pops after announcing it's been chosen as a supplier...

    Clean Diesel Technologies (OTC:CDTI +18.8%) pops after announcing it's been chosen as a supplier to Fisker Automotive. The company will supply catalysts for the Karma, Fisker's new luxury sedan, which starts shipping to both European and U.S. retailers this month

     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM
  • PQ

    PetroQuest Energy (PQ +9%) jumps after Raymond James ups the stock to market perform. The firm...

    PetroQuest Energy (PQ +9%) jumps after Raymond James ups the stock to market perform. The firm says cost reductions continue to improve the oil driller's balance sheet, and results from its Woodford shale project are much better than expected.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • AOS

    A.O. Smith (NYSE:AOS) is to acquire privately held rival Lochinvar for $418M, the company's...

    A.O. Smith (NYSE:AOS) is to acquire privately held rival Lochinvar for $418M, the company's first acquisition since it agreed to sell its motor business last December to focus on water-heating products. Earlier, A.O. Smith narrowed its 2011 outlook after posting higher Q2 numbers. AOS +6.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:35 AM
  • STLD

    Steel Dynamics (NASDAQ:STLD) reports after yesterday's close that Q2 profits more than doubled...

    Steel Dynamics (NASDAQ:STLD) reports after yesterday's close that Q2 profits more than doubled as increased steel shipments and higher selling prices offset softer performance in its recycling unit. Shares +4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM | 1 Comment
  • IDCC

    InterDigital (NASDAQ:IDCC) says it's hired Evercore (NYSE:EVR) and Barclays (NYSE:BCS) to...

    InterDigital (NASDAQ:IDCC) says it's hired Evercore (NYSE:EVR) and Barclays (NYSE:BCS) to explore strategic alternatives, including a possible sale. The developer of wireless technologies has seen the value of its intellectual property rise substantially this year, as patent bidding wars over smartphone technology have put the company at center stage. Shares +29% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM
  • IDCC

    Premarket gainers: IDCC +28%. HOG +9%. OTC:FEED +8%. JVA +6%. EK +6%. CTIC +6%. PII +5%. RBS...

    Premarket gainers: IDCC +28%. HOG +9%. OTC:FEED +8%. JVA +6%. EK +6%. CTIC +6%. PII +5%. RBS +5%. MGM +5%. XING +4%. ALU +4%. ING +4%. LYG +3%. NBG +3%. WYNN +3%. TZOO +3%. RENN +3%. MOS +3%. SINA +3%. NVS +3%. LVS +3%. ASML +3%.
    Losers: SBLK -16%. AVY -10%. GS -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • PII

    Polaris Industries (NYSE:PII) raises FY'11 EPS guidance to $5.93-$6.05 vs. $5.53-$5.68 on strong...

    Polaris Industries (NYSE:PII) raises FY'11 EPS guidance to $5.93-$6.05 vs. $5.53-$5.68 on strong Q2 sales (+41% Y/Y), citing strong consumer demand for its products. Shares +4.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:45 AM | 1 Comment
  • AVY

    Avery Dennison (NYSE:AVY) lowers its outlook for 2011 on weak Q2 sales and earnings. The firm...

    Avery Dennison (NYSE:AVY) lowers its outlook for 2011 on weak Q2 sales and earnings. The firm now sees FY'11 EPS of $2.45-$2.75 vs. $3-$3.30/share. Shares plummet -10.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:17 AM
  • GS

    More on Goldman's (NYSE:GS) earnings: The charges that pulled EPS down to $1.85 were the $600M...

    More on Goldman's (NYSE:GS) earnings: The charges that pulled EPS down to $1.85 were the $600M U.K. bank payroll tax and the $550M SEC settlement. Shares -3.1%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:15 AM | 2 Comments
  • GS

    Goldman Sachs (NYSE:GS): Q2 EPS, excluding certain charges, of $2.75. Inclusive of charges,...

    Goldman Sachs (NYSE:GS): Q2 EPS, excluding certain charges, of $2.75. Inclusive of charges, $1.85 vs. consensus of $2.35. Revenue of $7.3B (-18% Y/Y). Shares -2.6% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:06 AM | 2 Comments
  • KODK

    The ITC ends an investigation into Eastman Kodak (EK), centered on if the firm infringed on...

    The ITC ends an investigation into Eastman Kodak (EK), centered on if the firm infringed on Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) patents in its camera designs, by declining to review an earlier decision in the case. Shares of Eastman Kodak +5.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:01 AM
  • HOG

    More on Harley-Davidson's (NYSE:HOG) guidance: The firm sees, "gross margin to be between 34.0...

    More on Harley-Davidson's (NYSE:HOG) guidance: The firm sees, "gross margin to be between 34.0 percent and 35.0 percent for the full year, versus the prior estimate of 33.5 percent to 35.0 percent." Shares +3.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:48 AM
  • BAC

    More on BofA's (BAC +1.85%) earnings: "Obviously, the solid performance in our underlying...

    More on BofA's (BAC +1.85%) earnings: "Obviously, the solid performance in our underlying businesses continues to be clouded by the costs we are absorbing from our legacy mortgage issues." Mortgage-related charges were partially offset by lower credit costs, the sale of non-core assets, improved sales and trading revenues and higher asset management and I-banking fees. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:19 AM | 2 Comments
  • BAC

    Bank of America (NYSE:BAC): Q2 EPS of $0.33 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $13.48B (-50.2% Y/Y)....

    Bank of America (NYSE:BAC): Q2 EPS of $0.33 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $13.48B (-50.2% Y/Y). Shares +1.9% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:17 AM | 1 Comment
